newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Hamersley says settles Japan iron ore prices.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Hamersley says settles Japan iron ore prices.

text.p: Hamersley Iron Pty Ltd said on Tuesday it had settled 1997/98 (April-March) price negotiations with Japanese steel mills under the same terms as rival, The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd.
Fine ore prices will rise 1.1 percent to 29.10 US cents per dry long ton unit, while lump ore price were left unchanged at 37.68 US cents per dry long ton unit, the RTZ Corp Plc-CRA Ltd unit said.

BHP announced earlier on Tuesday it had settled under identical terms, saying the settlement reflected uncertain market conditions in Japan amid predictions Japanese steel production was likely to contract by about one million tonnes next year.
Analysts said the slight rise in fines prices represented a slight coup for Australian producers given the expectations of declining steel production.
The Hamersley settlement calls for shipments of 16.4 million tonnes, unchanged from 1996/97 a company spokesman said.
BHP said it would be shipping 14.6 million tonnes under the settlement terms, also unchanged from the previous year.
A spokesman for Hamersley said BHP was the first to settle with the Japanese worldwide for 1997/98, setting the stage for Australian and other iron ore producers worldwide.
"It can vary, but this year it was BHP," the spokesman said.
Another Australian miner, North Ltd, was likely to settle next, he added.
